comment.text: This translation key is used to display the account login type label in a filtering section, typically found on a contact list page. It will be displayed next to a button or dropdown option, allowing users to select their preferred login method. Translators should focus on adapting this text to fit various cultural contexts and user interfaces.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Тип вход в акаунта" is a rather literal and slightly awkward translation. A more natural Bulgarian phrasing would be "Вид на влизане в акаунт" or "Тип влизане в акаунт".
While technically correct, 'ປະເພດການເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບບັນຊີ' is a bit literal and verbose. A more natural Lao translation of 'Account login type' might be 'ປະເພດການເຂົ້າບັນຊີ' or 'ວິທີເຂົ້າບັນຊີ'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ວິທີເຂົ້າບັນຊີ or ປະເພດການເຂົ້າບັນຊີ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Rodzaj logowania na konto" is a bit clunky and not the most natural Polish phrasing. It translates literally as "Type of logging onto account." A more idiomatic translation would be better.

While 'Tip de conectare la cont' is understandable, a more natural and common translation of 'Account login type' would be 'Tipul de autentificare a contului' or 'Modalitate de autentificare a contului'. The current translation is a bit literal.

The translation 'පිවිසෙන ගිණුමේ වර්ගය' (pivīsena gīnumē varga-ya) translates more literally to 'entering account type'. 'Account login type' implies the *method* of login (e.g., password, biometric). A more accurate translation would convey that meaning.
The translation 'Typ prihlásenia na účet' is slightly literal and not the most natural phrasing in Slovak. While technically correct, it could be improved for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Typ prihlásenia účtu' or 'Zpôsob prihlásenia účtu'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, 'Vrsta prijave v račun' is a very literal translation and sounds a bit awkward in Slovenian. A more natural phrasing would be something along the lines of 'Način prijave na račun' or 'Tip prijave na račun'.
The translation 'Тип пријаве на налог' is not the most natural or precise translation of 'Account login type'. While understandable, 'Пријава на налог' is more common for 'account login'.

The translation 'Tip prijave na nalog' while understandable, isn't the most natural or precise translation of 'Account login type'. 'Tip' implies a general type, whereas 'Account login type' is more specific.
